name: Project
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Project
description:
Project

Projects are top-level containers in Google Cloud Platform. They store information about billing and authorized users, and they contain BigQuery data. Each project has a friendly name and a unique ID.

Gcloud::Bigquery::Project is the main object for interacting with Google BigQuery. Gcloud::Bigquery::Dataset objects are created, accessed, and deleted by Gcloud::Bigquery::Project.

See Gcloud#bigquery

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new "my-todo-project", "/path/to/keyfile.json"
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

bigquery.project #=> "my-todo-project"

require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

job = bigquery.query_job "SELECT name FROM [my_proj:my_data.my_table]"

job.wait_until_done!
if !job.failed?
  job.query_results.each do |row|
    puts row["name"]
  end
end

params.name: query
params.description: A query string, following the BigQuery query syntax, of the query to execute. Example: “SELECT count(f1) FROM [myProjectId:myDatasetId.myTableId]”.

params.name: priority
params.description: Specifies a priority for the query. Possible values include INTERACTIVE and BATCH. The default value is INTERACTIVE.

params.name: cache
params.description: Whether to look for the result in the query cache. The query cache is a best-effort cache that will be flushed whenever tables in the query are modified. The default value is true. For more information, see query caching.

params.name: table
params.description:
The destination table where the query results
should be stored. If not present, a new table will be created to store
the results.

params.name: create
params.description:
Specifies whether the job is allowed to create new tables.

The following values are supported: * needed - Create the table if it does not exist. * never - The table must already exist. A ‘notFound’ error is raised if the table does not exist.

params.name: write
params.description:
Specifies the action that occurs if the destination table already exists.

The following values are supported: * truncate - BigQuery overwrites the table data. * append - BigQuery appends the data to the table. * empty - A ‘duplicate’ error is returned in the job result if the table exists and contains data.

params.name: large_results
params.description: If true, allows the query to produce arbitrarily large result tables at a slight cost in performance. Requires table parameter to be set.

params.name: flatten
params.description: Flattens all nested and repeated fields in the query results. The default value is true. large_results parameter must be true if this is set to false.

params.name: dataset
params.description:
Specifies the default dataset to use
for unqualified table names in the query.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

data = bigquery.query "SELECT name FROM [my_proj:my_data.my_table]"
data.each do |row|
  puts row["name"]
end

params.name: query
params.description: A query string, following the BigQuery query syntax, of the query to execute. Example: “SELECT count(f1) FROM [myProjectId:myDatasetId.myTableId]”.

params.name: max
params.description:
The maximum number of rows of data to return per
page of results. Setting this flag to a small value such as 1000 and
then paging through results might improve reliability when the query
result set is large. In addition to this limit, responses are also
limited to 10 MB. By default, there is no maximum row count, and only
the byte limit applies.

params.name: timeout
params.description:
How long to wait for the query to complete, in
milliseconds, before the request times out and returns. Note that this
is only a timeout for the request, not the query. If the query takes
longer to run than the timeout value, the call returns without any
results and with QueryData#complete? set to false. The default value
is 10000 milliseconds (10 seconds).

params.name: dryrun
params.description: If set to true, BigQuery doesn’t run the job. Instead, if the query is valid, BigQuery returns statistics about the job such as how many bytes would be processed. If the query is invalid, an error returns. The default value is false.

params.name: cache
params.description: Whether to look for the result in the query cache. The query cache is a best-effort cache that will be flushed whenever tables in the query are modified. The default value is true. For more information, see query caching.

params.name: dataset
params.description:
Specifies the default datasetId and projectId to
assume for any unqualified table names in the query. If not set, all
table names in the query string must be qualified in the format
‘datasetId.tableId’.

params.name: project
params.description: Specifies the default projectId to assume for any unqualified table names in the query. Only used if dataset option is set.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
puts dataset.name

params.name: dataset_id
params.description: The ID of a dataset.

returns.description: Returns nil if the dataset does not exist.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

dataset = bigquery.create_dataset "my_dataset"

examples.caption: A name and description can be provided:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

dataset = bigquery.create_dataset "my_dataset",
                                  name: "My Dataset",
                                  description: "This is my Dataset"

examples.caption: Access rules can be provided with the access option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

dataset = bigquery.create_dataset "my_dataset",
  access: [{"role"=>"WRITER", "userByEmail"=>"writers@example.com"}]

examples.caption: Or, configure access with a block: (See Dataset::Access)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

dataset = bigquery.create_dataset "my_dataset" do |access|
  access.add_writer_user "writers@example.com"
end

params.name: dataset_id
params.description:
A unique ID for this dataset, without the
project name. The ID must contain only letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
(0-9), or underscores (_). The maximum length is 1,024 characters.

params.name: name
params.description: A descriptive name for the dataset.

params.name: description
params.description: A user-friendly description of the dataset.

params.name: expiration
params.description:
The default lifetime of all tables in the
dataset, in milliseconds. The minimum value is 3600000 milliseconds
(one hour).

params.name: access
params.description: The access rules for a Dataset using the Google Cloud Datastore API data structure of an array of hashes. See BigQuery Access Control for more information.

params.name: location
params.description: The geographic location where the dataset should reside. Possible values include EU and US. The default value is US.

params.name: yield
params.description: a block for setting rules

params.name: yield.access
params.description: the object accepting rules

methods.name: datasets
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Project#datasets
methods.description: Retrieves the list of datasets belonging to the project.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

datasets = bigquery.datasets
datasets.each do |dataset|
  puts dataset.name
end

examples.caption: Retrieve all datasets, including hidden ones, with :all:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

all_datasets = bigquery.datasets, all: true

examples.caption: With pagination: (See Dataset::List#token)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

all_datasets = []
tmp_datasets = bigquery.datasets
while tmp_datasets.any? do
  tmp_datasets.each do |dataset|
    all_datasets << dataset
  end
  # break loop if no more datasets available
  break if tmp_datasets.token.nil?
  # get the next group of datasets
  tmp_datasets = bigquery.datasets token: tmp_datasets.token
end

params.name: all
params.description: Whether to list all datasets, including hidden ones. The default is false.

params.name: token
params.description:
A previously-returned page token representing part
of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of datasets to return.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

job = bigquery.job "my_job"

params.name: job_id
params.description: The ID of a job.

returns.description: Returns nil if the job does not exist.

methods.name: jobs
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Project#jobs
methods.description: Retrieves the list of jobs belonging to the project.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

jobs = bigquery.jobs

examples.caption: Retrieve only running jobs using the :filter option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

running_jobs = bigquery.jobs filter: "running"

examples.caption: With pagination: (See Job::List#token)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

all_jobs = []
tmp_jobs = bigquery.jobs
while tmp_jobs.any? do
  tmp_jobs.each do |job|
    all_jobs << job
  end
  # break loop if no more jobs available
  break if tmp_jobs.token.nil?
  # get the next group of jobs
  tmp_jobs = bigquery.jobs token: tmp_jobs.token
end

params.name: all
params.description: Whether to display jobs owned by all users in the project. The default is false.

params.name: token
params.description:
A previously-returned page token representing part
of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of jobs to return.

params.name: filter
params.description:
A filter for job state.

Acceptable values are: * done - Finished jobs * pending - Pending jobs * running - Running jobs
